text:
I don't think there is any built-in GUI way. 
However, seeing the amount of available space is pretty easy from an elevated
PowerShell prompt (Get-Volume): 
[cid:image003.png@01DA446D.ED7F2DF0] 
If you need 250 MB, as others have suggested, it would fail in this example.

metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] You may hit a 0x80070643 - ERROR_INSTALL_FAILURE
metadata.email_text_original:
You don't often get email from michael@smithcons.com. Learn why this is
important [https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
I don't think there is any built-in GUI way. 
However, seeing the amount of available space is pretty easy from an elevated
PowerShell prompt (Get-Volume): 
[cid:image003.png@01DA446D.ED7F2DF0] 
If you need 250 MB, as others have suggested, it would fail in this example. 
-----Original Message-----
From: 'Susan Bradley' via PatchManagement <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, January 10, 2024 6:33 PM
To: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com
Subject: Re: [patchmanagement] You may hit a 0x80070643 - ERROR_INSTALL_FAILURE 
Think GUI for home users.  How do you mount a greyed out recovery 
partition?
Link: https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/patchmanagement/3540adab624f4bfb8c4ac468c94e0539%40smithcons.com
